It must have been pleasant to Horace to find even one among his friends illustrating in his life this modest Socratic creed 3 for he is so constantly enforcing it, in every variety of phrase and metaphor, that while we must conclude that he regarded it as the one doctrine most needful for his time, we must equally conclude that he , found it utterly disregarded.
